item.description:
Carpoolers needed! Please respond in the comments below or edit your RSVP to include how many passengers you can take. We need enough car space for about 15 people. Please let me know if you have a car and the number you can take. Thanks!

 

Please bring headlamps, flashlights, just in case we end up taking longer than expected to hike the mountain (aka into evening), windbreaker (the mountain top is unexpectedly chilly!), rain-wear, sweater, 2L water each (it's about 11 miles!), $10-15 for gas money for drivers if you carpool, and first-aid kits if you have them. With a lot of people, we are in greater need of sufficient first aid supplies. Preparedness and safety first! Thank you so much for your help!

 

Check your meetup.com email address for instructions as the date approaches! :)

Our Destination:

Franconia Notch!

Where: Lafayette campground Parking Lot
I-93 Exit 34B
Lincoln, NH

It is one of the most frequented high peaks in New Hampshire and part of the White Mountain range, noted for its varied hiking trails and great views. Please look at the website below for more info. This is not a beginner's hike, so please be prepared to hike at an intermediate level.


Franconia Notch Info: http://bit.ly/KQ9fsN.

 

Check out this map of Franconia and the trails:

http://hikethewhites.com/photos/map_franc.gif

and more info:

http://hikethewhites.com/hikes.html

 

The trail:

Franconia Ridge Loop (9 miles) - This is the classic White Mountain day hike. It starts in the heart of Franconia Notch and climbs the Falling Waters trail to the ridge itself. The ridge walk is the finest anywhere in the Whites. After reaching the summits of Lincoln and Lafayette, the route follows the Greenleaf trail to the AMC's Greenleaf Hut. From there, take the Old Bridle Path back to the trailhead.

 

From Hikethewhites.com:

Franconia Notch State Park rivals the Mt Washington area as the favorite tourist and hiker destination in the White Mountains. The most famous resident is the Old Man of the Mountains, a rock formation on the side of Cannon Mountain. There are many other attractions, including the Flume Gorge, Profile Lake, Echo Lake, the Basin, and Boise Rock.

The Cannon Ski Area and Tram is at the northern end of the notch. In the middle is the Lafayette Place Campground. There are many trails that start just off the Franconia Parkway which runs through the park, including the Old Bridle Path, Falling Waters, Lonesome Lake, Skookumchuck and Liberty Springs trails.

On the west side of the notch are North and South Kinsman, Lonesome Lake Hut, and Cannon Mountain. On the east side of the notch is Franconia Ridge, consisting of Lafayette with Greenleaf Hut, Lincoln,Liberty, and Flume.



Departure Details and Contact Info:


Everyone will meet at The Porter Square T station, parking lot in front of Shaws and Panera Bread. I don't know what the hours are, so if you drove, you might need to find on-street parking. Please feel free to ask questions in the comment section below or call Emilie (773-746-3710) if you have any questions or suggestions.

Current Drivers: Drew (4-5 Seats), Benny (4-5), Najat (4), ...

***Note: For safety, anyone in sandals and/or lacking water will not be allowed to carpool with the group to Franconia.


What You Need To Bring:


All summits are potentially hazardous due to high winds and unpredictable weather. Please bring appropriate provisions and hiking gear in preparation. Note it tends to be colder than expected at the summit. Please be sure to bring the following:


· Sturdy hiking boots (required)
· 2 Liters of water, minimum (required)
· Bag lunch and high-energy snacks like granola, nuts, energy bars, etc. (required)
· Wind and rain gear (required)
· Waterproof/breathable fabrics strongly recommended
· Synthetic or wool base layer – t-shirt, or underwear tops/btms
· Wool sweater or synthetic pile jacket
· A hat
· Gloves or mittens
· Extra socks (a welcome treat for the feet at mid-hike, or if you inadvertently step in a stream. They also double as mittens…)
· Bandanna or handkerchief
· Mini-First Aid Supplies

. Head lamp or strong flashlight (required) and extra batteries

.$10-15 for gas money if you are carpooling

 


PLEASE NOTE: HIKING HAS INHERENT RISKS. DO NOT ATTEND THIS MEETUP IF YOU ARE UNSURE IF YOU ARE ADEQUATELY PREPARED. AS A GROUP WE CAN DECREASE RISK BY BUDDYING UP AND LOOKING OUT FOR EACH OTHER BUT NOBODY IS LIABLE FOR YOU. THIS IS A VOLUNTARY HIKE. IF YOU ATTEND, YOU ARE ASSUMING THE RISK. HIKERS MUST BE AT LEAST 18 YEARS OF AGE.
item.how_to_find_us: Porter Square parking lot- group of people standing around in Hiking boots- call Emilie at 773-746-3710
item.name: Hike Franconia Notch
